dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, so, um, did you catch the news about the stock market this year? Like, pretty wild, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, so, um, did you catch the news about the stock market this year? Like, pretty wild, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, A! The S&P, uh, rising over 27%? That's just... incredible. One of the best years in recent history, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, A! The S and P, uh, rising over twenty seven percent? That's just... incredible. One of the best years in recent history, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock markets explosive growth this yearthe S&P has risen more than 27%means that 2019 is shaping up to be one of the best years for investing in recent history

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild. And, like, no surprise, the tech giants really led the charge. Apple, Microsoft, you know, just racking up billions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild. And, like, no surprise, the tech giants really led the charge. Apple, Microsoft, you know, just racking up billions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are the ten companies that saw their market cap gain the most in 2019, with a combined total increase of nearly $2 trillion: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion... Microsoft, another top-performing tech giant... saw its market cap rise by $408 billion

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Apple, um, they had a blockbuster year, market value up almost half a trillion dollars, largely thanks to new products and, like, Apple TV+.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Apple, um, they had a blockbuster year, market value up almost half a trillion dollars, largely thanks to new products and, like, Apple T V plus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion to nearly $1.25 trillion, as its stock hit numerous new record highs in the second half of 2019. The company benefited from strong product sales and its entry into the streaming wars with Apple TV+.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And Microsoft, too, with their cloud business, I mean, neck and neck with Apple for most valuable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Microsoft, too, with their cloud business, I mean, neck and neck with Apple for most valuable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft, another top-performing tech giant, which has greatly expanded its cloud business this year, saw its market cap rise by $408 billion to a total of $1.19 trillion running neck-and-neck with Apple for the title of the worlds most valuable company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And then you have Google, Facebook, Amazon, all seeing these massive gains, like, over $100 billion each in market cap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And then you have Google, Facebook, Amazon, all seeing these massive gains, like, over one hundred billion dollars each in market cap.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google... has seen its market cap go up by $214 billion... Facebook... has gained $213 billion in market value... Amazon has seen its market value go up by almost $150 billion

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But it wasn't just tech, right? I saw Visa and JPMorgan Chase up there, even Disney with Disney+ doing so well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it wasn't just tech, right? I saw Visa and J P Morgan Chase up there, even Disney with Disney plus doing so well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Other stocks that have made big gains in market value this year include financial services companies like Visa ($115 billion), JPMorgan Chase ($111 billion) and Mastercard ($106 billion). The companies rounding out the top 10: Disney ($100 billion), which launched its new and highly successful Disney+ streaming service in the fall

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure, Disney was a huge win. But, you know, while some companies boomed, others really, uh, struggled. It's not all sunshine and rainbows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure, Disney was a huge win. But, you know, while some companies boomed, others really, uh, struggled. It's not all sunshine and rainbows.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely a tale of two markets. I mean, DuPont, for example, their market cap got slashed in half after spinning off businesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely a tale of two markets. I mean, DuPont, for example, their market cap got slashed in half after spinning off businesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: DuPont, previously the worlds largest chemical conglomerate, spun off numerous businesses throughout the year, including its commodity chemical subsidiary Dow and agricultural unit Corteva, which slashed the companys market cap by more than half in April.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Pfizer, too, like, down over $33 billion. Declining sales, a merger that Wall Street didn't love...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Pfizer, too, like, down over thirty three billion dollars. Declining sales, a merger that Wall Street didn't love...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer saw its market value fall just over $33 billionto $218 billionin 2019. Thats due to declining sales and the merger of its Upjohn generic drugs division with Mylan earlier in the year, which generated a negative reaction from Wall Street analysts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or Kraft Heinz, with that huge brand writedown. Warren Buffett's holdings took a hit there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or Kraft Heinz, with that huge brand writedown. Warren Buffett's holdings took a hit there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kraft Heinz, one of billionaire investor Warren Buffetts biggest holdings (almost a 27% stake), saw its stock fall more than 30% in late February after the company wrote down the value of iconic brands Kraft and Oscar Mayer by more than $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, thirty percent down! And Walgreens Boots Alliance, facing all that online competition, had a rough year too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, thirty percent down! And Walgreens Boots Alliance, facing all that online competition, had a rough year too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kraft Heinz... saw its stock fall more than 30% in late February... Walgreens Boots Alliance: The international drug store chains market cap has decreased $13.1 billion this year, to $52 billion, as the company faces heightened concerns about competition from online retailers

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, while tech and some innovative companies soared, um, others in pharma, chemicals, and traditional consumer goods kind of got left behind.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, while tech and some innovative companies soared, um, others in pharma, chemicals, and traditional consumer goods kind of got left behind.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the boom times have also left some competitors behind, among them some of the countrys biggest pharmaceutical, chemical, and consumer goods companies, reflecting changing times.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It really shows how much the landscape is, uh, shifting, doesn't it? Changing times for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It really shows how much the landscape is, uh, shifting, doesn't it? Changing times for sure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. What a year for the markets!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. What a year for the markets!
